problem_text: Pets are allowed in some managed buildings. [BG] A deposit is required to rent an apartment in a managed building. The security deposit can be either equal to one month's rent or more. Fluffy is Tom's cat. Cats are pets. The Olive Garden is a managed building. The monthly rent at the Olive Garden is $2000. Tom will rent an apartment in a managed building if and only if he is allowed to move in with Fluffy, and the security deposit is no more than $1500. 2000$ is more than $1500.
predicates:
AllowedPet(x, y) ::: Pet x is allowed in building y.
ManagedBuilding(x) ::: x is a managed building.
DepositRequired(x) ::: A deposit is required to rent an apartment in building x.
RentAmount(x, y) ::: The monthly rent for building x is y.
DepositAmount(x, y) ::: The security deposit for building x is y.
DepositGreaterThanOneMonthRent(x) ::: The security deposit for building x is more than one month's rent.
DepositEqualToOneMonthRent(x) ::: The security deposit for building x is equal to one month's rent.
Cat(x) ::: x is a cat.
Pet(x) ::: x is a pet.
Owns(x, y) ::: x owns pet y.
Apartment(x) ::: x is an apartment.
Rent(x, y) ::: Person x rents apartment y.
MoveIn(x, y) ::: Person x moves into building y.
Fluffy(x) ::: x is Fluffy.
Tom(x) ::: x is Tom.
OliveGarden(x) ::: x is the Olive Garden.
MoreThan(x, y) ::: x is greater than y.
LessThan(x, y) ::: x is less than y.

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Tom will rent an apartment in the Olive Garden.
tests.conclusions: Rent(tom, apartment_olive_garden) ::: Tom will rent an apartment in the Olive Garden. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Fluffy is allowed in the Olive Garden.
tests.conclusions: AllowedPet(fluffy, oliveGarden) ::: Fluffy is allowed in the Olive Garden. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Tom will rent an apartment in the Olive Garden and the security deposit is equal to one month's rent.
tests.conclusions: Rent(tom, oliveGarden) ∧ DepositEqualToOneMonthRent(oliveGarden) ::: Tom will rent an apartment in the Olive Garden and the security deposit is equal to one month's rent. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? The security deposit for the Olive Garden is more than one month's rent.
tests.conclusions: DepositGreaterThanOneMonthRent(oliveGarden) ::: The security deposit for the Olive Garden is more than one month's rent. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Tom will rent an apartment in the Olive Garden if and only if the security deposit for the Olive Garden is equal to one month's rent.
tests.conclusions: MoveIn(tom, oliveGarden) ↔ DepositEqualToOneMonthRent(oliveGarden) ::: Tom will rent an apartment in the Olive Garden if and only if the security deposit for the Olive Garden is equal to one month's rent. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Tom will rent an apartment in the Olive Garden if he is allowed to move in with Fluffy.
tests.conclusions: AllowedPet(fluffy, olivegarden) → Rent(tom, olivegarden) ::: Tom will rent an apartment in the Olive Garden if he is allowed to move in with Fluffy. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Tom will rent an apartment in the Olive Garden and Fluffy is a pet.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Tom will rent an apartment in the Olive Garden.
tests.conclusions: Rent(tom, oliveGarden) ::: Tom will rent an apartment in the Olive Garden. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Tom will rent an apartment in the Olive Garden and the security deposit for the Olive Garden is no more than $1500.
tests.conclusions: MoveIn(tom, OliveGarden) ∧ ¬DepositGreaterThanOneMonthRent(OliveGarden) ::: Tom will rent an apartment in the Olive Garden and the security deposit for the Olive Garden is no more than $1500. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Tom will rent an apartment in the Olive Garden if and only if Fluffy is allowed in the Olive Garden and the security deposit for the Olive Garden is equal to one month's rent.

candidate_solutions.text:
# Predicates:
AllowedPet(x, y) ::: Pet x is allowed in building y.
ManagedBuilding(x) ::: x is a managed building.
DepositRequired(x) ::: A deposit is required to rent an apartment in building x.
RentAmount(x, y) ::: The monthly rent for building x is y.
DepositAmount(x, y) ::: The security deposit for building x is y.
DepositGreaterThanOneMonthRent(x) ::: The security deposit for building x is more than one month's rent.
DepositEqualToOneMonthRent(x) ::: The security deposit for building x is equal to one month's rent.
Cat(x) ::: x is a cat.
Pet(x) ::: x is a pet.
Owns(x, y) ::: x owns pet y.
Apartment(x) ::: x is an apartment.
Rent(x, y) ::: Person x rents apartment y.
MoveIn(x, y) ::: Person x moves into building y.
Fluffy(x) ::: x is Fluffy.
Tom(x) ::: x is Tom.
OliveGarden(x) ::: x is the Olive Garden.
MoreThan(x, y) ::: x is greater than y.
LessThan(x, y) ::: x is less than y.

# Premises:
∃y ManagedBuilding(y) ∧ AllowedPet(fluffy, y) ::: Pets are allowed in some managed buildings.
∀x (ManagedBuilding(x) → DepositRequired(x)) ::: A deposit is required to rent an apartment in a managed building.
∀x (DepositRequired(x) → (DepositEqualToOneMonthRent(x) ∨ DepositGreaterThanOneMonthRent(x))) ::: The security deposit can be either equal to one month's rent or more.
Cat(fluffy) ∧ Owns(tom, fluffy) ::: Fluffy is Tom's cat.
∀x (Cat(x) → Pet(x)) ::: Cats are pets.
ManagedBuilding(oliveGarden) ::: The Olive Garden is a managed building.
RentAmount(oliveGarden, 2000) ::: The monthly rent at the Olive Garden is $2000.
∀x ∀y (Rent(tom, y) → (MoveIn(tom, y) ↔ (AllowedPet(fluffy, y) ∧ LessThan(DepositAmount(y, 1500), 1500)))) ::: Tom will rent an apartment in a managed building if and only if he is allowed to move in with Fluffy, and the security deposit is no more than $1500.
MoreThan(2000, 1500) ::: 2000$ is more than $1500.

validation.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true, false, or uncertain? Tom will rent an apartment in The Olive Garden.
validation.conclusions: Rent(tom, apartment) ∧ MoveIn(tom, oliveGarden) ::: Tom will rent an apartment in The Olive Garden. false
